text: Place the flour and salt into a large bowl.  Using a dough hook, add 300ml of the water. Mix for about 3 minutes. The current dough won't bind, therefore, add 50ml, and mix again. Add the remaining 50ml of lukewarm water, if your dough needs it.  Add 15 ml of olive oil. Mix for about 1 minute. Place the dough on a lightly floured surface. Roll to a 30 centimeter (11.8 in) by 15 centimeter (5.9 in) rectangle, leave to rest for 10 minutes. Grease a tin with flour, thoroughly.  Put in a loaf tin. Alternatively, make 10 rolls. Sprinkle with flour. Put in a warm place for 30 minutes to rise.  After 20 minutes, preheat the oven to 230ºC, 210ºC (fan). When the oven has preheated, put rolls in. Bake for 10 to 15 minutes if rolls or 25 to 30minutes if a loaf.  Remove when baked. Leave to cool on a wire rack. Serve. Enjoy!
